dolls.name: Barbie
dolls.description: Barbie is a fashion doll manufactured by the American toy company Mattel, Inc. and launched in March 1959.

dolls.name: Teddy Bear
dolls.description: A teddy bear is a soft toy in the form of a bear. It is usually stuffed with soft, white cotton and has a cute appearance.

dolls.name: Cabbage Patch Kids
dolls.description: Cabbage Patch Kids are a line of soft-sculpture dolls created by Xavier Roberts and registered as a trademark by the American Greetings Corporation.

dolls.name: Raggedy Ann
dolls.description: Raggedy Ann is a character created by American writer Johnny Gruelle. She is a rag doll with red yarn hair and a triangle nose.

dolls.name: Ken
dolls.description: Ken is a fashion doll introduced by Mattel in 1961. He is Barbie's boyfriend and often seen as her male counterpart.

dolls.name: Bratz
dolls.description: Bratz is a line of fashion dolls and merchandise manufactured by MGA Entertainment. They are known for their oversized heads and stylish outfits.

dolls.name: American Girl
dolls.description: American Girl dolls are a line of 18-inch dolls created by Pleasant Company, now a subsidiary of Mattel. Each doll represents a different historical period and comes with a book.

dolls.name: G.I. Joe
dolls.description: G.I. Joe is a line of action figures produced by Hasbro. They depict members of the U.S. military and have been popular since the 1960s.

dolls.name: Baby Alive
dolls.description: Baby Alive is a line of dolls that simulate eating, drinking, and other baby activities. They are designed to provide a nurturing play experience.

dolls.name: Troll Dolls
dolls.description: Troll Dolls are plastic dolls with colorful hair that stands up straight. They gained popularity in the 1960s and have remained popular collectibles.

dolls.name: L.O.L. Surprise!
dolls.description: L.O.L. Surprise! dolls are collectible dolls with layers of surprises. Each doll comes in a ball-shaped container and reveals different accessories and outfits.

dolls.name: Monster High
dolls.description: Monster High is a fashion doll franchise created by Mattel. The dolls are inspired by monster movies and feature characters who are the offspring of famous monsters.

dolls.name: Blythe
dolls.description: Blythe is a fashion doll with a unique look characterized by oversized heads and large eyes that change color with a pull-string mechanism. Blythe dolls have gained a following among collectors.

dolls.name: My Little Pony
dolls.description: My Little Pony is a toy line and media franchise featuring colorful pony characters. The dolls have manes and tails that can be brushed and styled.

dolls.name: Ever After High
dolls.description: Ever After High is a fashion doll franchise launched by Mattel. The dolls are based on characters from fairy tales and depict the next generation of famous fairy tale characters.

dolls.name: Strawberry Shortcake
dolls.description: Strawberry Shortcake is a character and doll line created by American Greetings. The dolls feature a young girl with strawberry-themed clothes and accessories.

dolls.name: Cry Babies
dolls.description: Cry Babies are interactive dolls that cry real tears. They come with accessories and make sounds to simulate the experience of caring for a crying baby.

dolls.name: Disney Princess
dolls.description: Disney Princess dolls feature characters from Disney animated films, such as Cinderella, Ariel, and Belle. They are often dressed in elaborate costumes and are popular among young fans.

dolls.name: Bratzillaz
dolls.description: Bratzillaz are a spin-off line of Bratz dolls with a supernatural theme. The dolls are witches with unique powers and fashions.

dolls.name: Winx Club
dolls.description: Winx Club is an Italian animated television series and doll line. The dolls depict a group of fairies with magical powers and colorful fashion styles.
